apiClassifier.shortdesc: A search query object manages the criteria to apply when searching app content that you have previously indexed using the Core Spotlight APIs.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc: A search query object manages the criteria to apply when searching app content that you have previously indexed using the Core Spotlight APIs. See https://developer.apple.com/documentation/corespotlight/cssearchquery

apiParam.apiDesc: an array of attribute names that correspond to properties defined by SearchableItemAttributeSet

apiOperation.shortdesc: Asynchronously queries the index for items that match the query object’s specifications.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Asynchronously queries the index for items that match the query object’s specifications.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Call this method to delete all searchable items from the index.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Call this method to delete all searchable items from the index.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Call this method on the index to remove any items from the index with the given identifiers or domain identifiers.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Call this method on the index to remove any items from the index with the given identifiers or domain identifiers. The delete is recursive so if domain identifiers are of the form account-id.mailbox-id, for example, calling delete with account-id will delte all the searchable items with that account and any mailbox.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Call this method to add or update items in the index.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Call this method to add or update items in the index.

apiValue.shortdesc: Not all devices support indexing.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Not all devices support indexing. Read this property to check if indexing is supported on the current device.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: The set of properties to display for a searchable item.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc: The set of properties to display for a searchable item.

apiValue.shortdesc: Array of the canonical handles of the account the item is associated with (IM handle, e-mail address, phone number...).

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Array of the canonical handles of the account the item is associated with (IM handle, e-mail address, phone number...). E.g. in Mail's case, all the email addresses the account receives email on.

apiValue.shortdesc: Unique identifier for the account the item is associated with, if any

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Unique identifier for the account the item is associated with, if any

apiValue.shortdesc: Device make that was used to acquire this item

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Device make that was used to acquire this item

apiValue.shortdesc: Device model that was used to acquire this item

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Device model that was used to acquire this item

apiValue.shortdesc: This is the date that the item was moved into the current location.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: This is the date that the item was moved into the current location.

apiValue.shortdesc: An array of Person objects representing the content of the Cc: field in an email

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: An array of Person objects representing the content of the Cc: field in an email

apiValue.shortdesc: The title for a collection of media.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The title for a collection of media. This is analagous to a record album, or photo album whichs are collections of audio or images.

apiValue.shortdesc: Whether this event covers complete days

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Whether this event covers complete days

apiValue.shortdesc: An array of localized strings of alternate display names for this item.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: An array of localized strings of alternate display names for this item.

apiValue.shortdesc: The altitude of the item in meters above sea level, expressed using the WGS84 datum.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The altitude of the item in meters above sea level, expressed using the WGS84 datum. Negative values lie below sea level.

apiValue.shortdesc: The size of the lens aperture as a log-scale APEX value when the image was acquired.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The size of the lens aperture as a log-scale APEX value when the image was acquired.

apiValue.shortdesc: The artist for the media

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The artist for the media

apiValue.shortdesc: A class of entity for whom the resource is intended or useful.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: A class of entity for whom the resource is intended or useful. A class of entity may be determined by the creator or the publisher or by a third party.

apiValue.shortdesc: The audio bit rate

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The audio bit rate

apiValue.shortdesc: The number of channels in the audio data contained in the file.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The number of channels in the audio data contained in the file. This item only represents the number of discreet channels of audio data found in the file. It does not indicate any configuration of the data in regards to a user's speaker setup.

apiValue.shortdesc: The name of the application that encoded the data contained in the audio file.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The name of the application that encoded the data contained in the audio file.

apiValue.shortdesc: The sample rate of the audio data contained in the file.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The sample rate of the audio data contained in the file. The sample rate is a float value representing hz (audio_frames/second). For example: 44100.0, 22254.54.

apiValue.shortdesc: The track number of a song/composition when it is part of an album

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The track number of a song/composition when it is part of an album

apiValue.shortdesc: This attribute indicates the author addresses of the document.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: This attribute indicates the author addresses of the document.

apiValue.shortdesc: This attribute indicates the author of the emails message addresses.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: This attribute indicates the author of the emails message addresses. (This is always the email address, and not the human readable version)

apiValue.shortdesc: The list of author/authors that have worked on this item.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The list of author/authors that have worked on this item. There could be 0 or more authors of a particular item. The order of the authors in the array is preserved, but is not intended to represent the main author or relative importance of the authors.

apiValue.shortdesc: An array of Person objects representing the content of the From: field in an email

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: An array of Person objects representing the content of the From: field in an email

apiValue.shortdesc: Number of bits per sample For example bit depth of an image (8-bit, 16-bit etc..) or bit depth per audio sample of uncompressed audio data (8, 16, 24, 32, 64, etc..)

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Number of bits per sample For example bit depth of an image (8-bit, 16-bit etc..) or bit depth per audio sample of uncompressed audio data (8, 16, 24, 32, 64, etc..)

apiValue.shortdesc: The owner of the camera used to capture this image.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The owner of the camera used to capture this image.

apiValue.shortdesc: Identifies city of item origin according to guidelines established by the provider.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Identifies city of item origin according to guidelines established by the provider.

apiValue.shortdesc: The codecs used to encode/decode the media

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The codecs used to encode/decode the media

apiValue.shortdesc: What color space model is this item following (For example, "RGB", "CMYK", "YUV", "YCbCr")

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: What color space model is this item following (For example, "RGB", "CMYK", "YUV", "YCbCr")

apiValue.shortdesc: This is a comment related to a file.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: This is a comment related to a file.

apiValue.shortdesc: Date the item was completed

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Date the item was completed

apiValue.shortdesc: The composer of the song/composition contained in the audio file.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The composer of the song/composition contained in the audio file.

apiValue.shortdesc: A list of contacts that are somehow associated with this document, beyond what is captured as Author.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: A list of contacts that are somehow associated with this document, beyond what is captured as Author.

apiValue.shortdesc: This is the date that the contents of the item were created

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: This is the date that the contents of the item were created

apiValue.shortdesc: An account of the content of the resource.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: An account of the content of the resource. Description may include but is not limited to: an abstract, table of contents, reference to a graphical representation of content or a free-text account of the content.

apiValue.shortdesc: This is the date that the contents of the item were last modified

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: This is the date that the contents of the item were last modified

apiValue.shortdesc: Whether or not the item has explicit content.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Whether or not the item has explicit content.

apiValue.shortdesc: This attribute indicates where the item was obtained from.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: This attribute indicates where the item was obtained from. Examples: - downloaded file may refer to the site they were downloaded from,the refering URL, etc - files received by email may indicate who sent the file, the message subject, etc

apiValue.shortdesc: UTI Type pedigree for an item.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: UTI Type pedigree for an item. Common types can be found in ContentType

apiValue.shortdesc: Optional file URL representing the content to be indexed.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc:
Optional file URL representing the content to be indexed.
Applications that are also 'Documents & Data' clients can set this property to allow Spotlight to deduplicate their searchable items against the iCloud Drive's items. When this property is set, Spotlight will not display the iCloud Drive's searchable items that have the same contentURL property.

apiValue.shortdesc: Used to designate the entity responsible for making contributions to the content of the resource.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Used to designate the entity responsible for making contributions to the content of the resource. Examples of a Contributor include a person, an organization or a service. Typically, the name of a Contributor should be used to indicate the entity.

apiValue.shortdesc: This is the copyright of the content.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: This is the copyright of the content.

apiValue.shortdesc: Provides full, publishable, name of the country/primary location where the intellectual property of the item was created,according to guidelines of the provider.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Provides full, publishable, name of the country/primary location where the intellectual property of the item was created,according to guidelines of the provider.

apiValue.shortdesc: Used to designate the extent or scope of the content of the resource.

apiDesc.p: Used to designate the extent or scope of the content of the resource. Coverage will typically include spatial location (a place name or geographic co-ordinates), temporal period (a period label, date, or date range) or jurisdiction (such as a named administrative entity).

Recommended best practice is to select a value from a controlled vocabulary, and that, where appropriate, named places or time periods be used in preference to numeric identifiers such as sets of co-ordinates or date ranges.

apiValue.shortdesc: Application used to create the document content (e.g.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Application used to create the document content (e.g. "Word", "Framemaker", etc.).

apiValue.shortdesc: The delivery type of the item.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The delivery type of the item. Should be 0 for fast start and 1 for RTSP.

apiValue.shortdesc: Director of the item (e.g.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Director of the item (e.g. movie director)

apiValue.shortdesc: A localized string to be displayed in the UI for this item.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: A localized string to be displayed in the UI for this item.

apiValue.shortdesc: This property has the same semantics as -[CSSearchableItem domainIdentifier].

apiValueDetail.apiDesc:
This property has the same semantics as -[CSSearchableItem domainIdentifier].
It can be set on the contentAttributeSet property of a NSUserActivity instance and then used to delete the user activity by calling [[SearchableIndex defaultSearchableIndex] deleteSearchableItemsWithDomainIdentifiers:]. iOS 11.0+

apiValue.shortdesc: This is the date that the file was last downloaded / received.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: This is the date that the file was last downloaded / received.

apiValue.shortdesc: Date this item is due.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Date this item is due.

apiValue.shortdesc: This is the duration, in seconds, of the content of the item (if appropriate).

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: This is the duration, in seconds, of the content of the item (if appropriate).

apiValue.shortdesc: The list of editor/editors that have worked on this item.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The list of editor/editors that have worked on this item.

apiValue.shortdesc: mail addresses for this item.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: mail addresses for this item.

apiValue.shortdesc: JSON string with all the headers of the message Keys are header names and values arrays of strings (because a header might be present multiple times in an email)

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: JSON string with all the headers of the message Keys are header names and values arrays of strings (because a header might be present multiple times in an email)

apiValue.shortdesc: Software used to convert the original content into a PDF stream (e.g.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Software used to convert the original content into a PDF stream (e.g. "Distiller", etc.).

apiValue.shortdesc: End date for this item.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: End date for this item.

apiValue.shortdesc: The verion of the EXIF header that was used to generate the metadata

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The verion of the EXIF header that was used to generate the metadata

apiValue.shortdesc: The version of GPSInfoIFD header that was used to generate the metadata

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The version of GPSInfoIFD header that was used to generate the metadata

apiValue.shortdesc: Mode that was used for the exposure.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Mode that was used for the exposure. Should be 0 for AutoExposure, 1 for Manual, 2 for AutoBracket.

apiValue.shortdesc: The class of the program used by the camera to set exposure when the picture is taken (Manual, Normal, Aperture Priority, ...)

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The class of the program used by the camera to set exposure when the picture is taken (Manual, Normal, Aperture Priority, ...)

apiValue.shortdesc: The time of the exposure as a string, e.g.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The time of the exposure as a string, e.g. "1/250 seconds".

apiValue.shortdesc: Time that the lens was public during exposure in seconds

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Time that the lens was public during exposure in seconds

apiValue.shortdesc: The focal length of the lens divided by the diameter of the aperture when the image was acquired.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The focal length of the lens divided by the diameter of the aperture when the image was acquired.

apiValue.shortdesc: Size of the document in MB.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Size of the document in MB.

apiValue.shortdesc: Indicates if the flash was used to take the picture.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Indicates if the flash was used to take the picture. Should be true if flash is on, false otherwise.

apiValue.shortdesc: Indicates if the focal length is 35mm.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Indicates if the focal length is 35mm. Should be 1 if true, 0 otherwise

apiValue.shortdesc: The actual focal length of the lens in mm.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The actual focal length of the lens in mm.

apiValue.shortdesc: Array of font names used in the item.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Array of font names used in the item.

apiValue.shortdesc: The fully formatted address of the item (obtained from MapKit)

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The fully formatted address of the item (obtained from MapKit)

apiValue.shortdesc: This attribute indicates whether the MIDI sequence contained in the file is setup for use with a General MIDI device.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: This attribute indicates whether the MIDI sequence contained in the file is setup for use with a General MIDI device.

apiValue.shortdesc: Genre of the item (e.g.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Genre of the item (e.g. movie genre)

apiValue.shortdesc: The direction of travel of the item, in degrees from true north.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The direction of travel of the item, in degrees from true north.

apiValue.shortdesc: Indicates if this image file has an alpha channel.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Indicates if this image file has an alpha channel. Should be 0 for no alpha channel, 1 for alpha channel.

apiValue.shortdesc: A publishable entry providing a synopsis of the contents of the item.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: A publishable entry providing a synopsis of the contents of the item.

apiValue.shortdesc: An array of Person objects representing the content of the Bcc: field in an email

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: An array of Person objects representing the content of the Bcc: field in an email

apiValue.shortdesc: Contains the HTML content of the document encoded as an UTF-8 encoded string.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Contains the HTML content of the document encoded as an UTF-8 encoded string.

apiValue.shortdesc: Used to reference to the resource within a given context.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Used to reference to the resource within a given context. Recommended best practice is to identify the resource by means of a string or number conforming to a formal identification system.

apiValue.shortdesc: The direction of the item's image, in degrees from true north.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The direction of the item's image, in degrees from true north.

apiValue.shortdesc: Important dates associated with this item

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Important dates associated with this item

apiValue.shortdesc: Information about the item

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Information about the item

apiValue.shortdesc: Instant message addresses for this item.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Instant message addresses for this item.

apiValue.shortdesc: Other editorial instructions concerning the use of the item, such as embargoes and warnings.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Other editorial instructions concerning the use of the item, such as embargoes and warnings.

apiValue.shortdesc: The ISO Speed the camera was set to when the image was taken.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The ISO Speed the camera was set to when the image was taken. Examples are 100, 200, 400, etc.

apiValue.shortdesc: The musical key of the song/composition contained in an audio file.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The musical key of the song/composition contained in an audio file. For example: C, Dm, F#m, Bb.

apiValue.shortdesc: Represents keywords associated with this particular item.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Represents keywords associated with this particular item. Example Keywords might be Birthday,Important etc.

apiValue.shortdesc: Kind that this item represents.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Kind that this item represents.

apiValue.shortdesc: Used to designate the languages of the intellectual content of the resource.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Used to designate the languages of the intellectual content of the resource. Recommended best practice for the values of the Language element is defined by BCP 47.

apiValue.shortdesc: This is the date that the item was last used

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: This is the date that the item was last used

apiValue.shortdesc: The latitude of the item in degrees north of the equator, expressed using the WGS84 datum.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The latitude of the item in degrees north of the equator, expressed using the WGS84 datum. Negative values lie south of the equator.

apiValue.shortdesc: The names of the various layers in the file

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The names of the various layers in the file

apiValue.shortdesc: The model of the lens used to capture this image.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The model of the lens used to capture this image.

apiValue.shortdesc: This attribute indicates if the document is likely to be considered junk.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: This attribute indicates if the document is likely to be considered junk.

apiValue.shortdesc: Whether or not the item is local.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Whether or not the item is local.

apiValue.shortdesc: The longitude of the item in degrees east of the prime meridian, expressed using the WGS84 datum.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The longitude of the item in degrees east of the prime meridian, expressed using the WGS84 datum. Negative values lie west of the prime meridian.

apiValue.shortdesc: The lyricist/text writer for song/composition contained in the audio file.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The lyricist/text writer for song/composition contained in the audio file.

apiValue.shortdesc: Array of Mailbox identifiers associated with the item.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Array of Mailbox identifiers associated with the item. e.g. 'mailbox.inbox', 'mailbox.drafts', 'mailbox.sent', or a custom identifier etc.

apiValue.shortdesc: The smallest F number of the lens.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The smallest F number of the lens. The unit is the APEX value. Ordinarily it is given in the range of 00.00 to 99.99.

apiValue.shortdesc: Media types present in the content

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Media types present in the content

apiValue.shortdesc: This is the date that the last metadata attribute was changed.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: This is the date that the last metadata attribute was changed.

apiValue.shortdesc: The metering mode for the image (Average, Partial, Pattern, ...)

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The metering mode for the image (Average, Partial, Pattern, ...)

apiValue.shortdesc: The musical genre of the song/composition contained in the audio file.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The musical genre of the song/composition contained in the audio file. For example: Jazz, Pop, Rock, Classical.

apiValue.shortdesc: Meta data attribute that stores the category of instrument.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Meta data attribute that stores the category of instrument. Files should have an instrument associated with them ("Other Instrument" is provided as a catch-all). For some categories, like "Keyboards" there are instrument names which provide a more detailed instrument definition (e.g., Piano,Organ, etc.)

apiValue.shortdesc: Meta data attribute that stores the name of instrument (relative to the instrument category) Files can have an instrument name associated with them if they have certain instrument categories (e.g., the category Percussion has multiple instruments, including Conga and Bongo).

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Meta data attribute that stores the name of instrument (relative to the instrument category) Files can have an instrument name associated with them if they have certain instrument categories (e.g., the category Percussion has multiple instruments, including Conga and Bongo).

apiValue.shortdesc: The name of the location or point of interest associated with the item.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The name of the location or point of interest associated with the item. The name may be user provided.

apiValue.shortdesc: Used to indicate company/Organization that created the document.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Used to indicate company/Organization that created the document.

apiValue.shortdesc: The orientation of the data.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The orientation of the data. Should be 0 for Landscape or 1 for Portrait.

apiValue.shortdesc: Original format of the movie

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Original format of the movie

apiValue.shortdesc: Original source of the movie

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Original source of the movie

apiValue.shortdesc: Number of pages in the item.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Number of pages in the item.

apiValue.shortdesc: Height in points (72 points per inch) of the document page (first page only for PDF's - other pages within the PDF may not be the same height).

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Height in points (72 points per inch) of the document page (first page only for PDF's - other pages within the PDF may not be the same height).

apiValue.shortdesc: Width in points (72 points per inch) of the document page (first page only for PDF's - other pages within the PDF may not be the same width).

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Width in points (72 points per inch) of the document page (first page only for PDF's - other pages within the PDF may not be the same width).

apiValue.shortdesc: The list of people who are visible in an image or movie or written about in a document.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The list of people who are visible in an image or movie or written about in a document.

apiValue.shortdesc: This is the complete path to the item.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: This is the complete path to the item.

apiValue.shortdesc: Performers in the movie

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Performers in the movie

apiValue.shortdesc: Phone numbers for this item.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Phone numbers for this item.

apiValue.shortdesc: The total number of pixels in the item.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The total number of pixels in the item.

apiValue.shortdesc: The height of the item in pixels (ie Image height or Video frame height)

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The height of the item in pixels (ie Image height or Video frame height)

apiValue.shortdesc: The width of the item in pixels (ie Image width or Video frame width)

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The width of the item in pixels (ie Image width or Video frame width)

apiValue.shortdesc: User play count of this item

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: User play count of this item

apiValue.shortdesc: The postal code for the item according to guidelines established by the provider.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The postal code for the item according to guidelines established by the provider.

apiValue.shortdesc: An array of Person objects representing the content of the To: field in an email

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: An array of Person objects representing the content of the To: field in an email

apiValue.shortdesc: Producer of the content

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Producer of the content

apiValue.shortdesc: Name of the color profile used for the image

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Name of the color profile used for the image

apiValue.shortdesc: The list of projects that this item is part of.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc:
The list of projects that this item is part of.
For example if you were working on a movie, all of the movie files could be marked as belonging to the project "My movie"

apiValue.shortdesc: Used to designate the entity responsible for making the resource available.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Used to designate the entity responsible for making the resource available. Examples of a Publisher include a person, an organization, or a service. Typically, the name of a Publisher should be used to indicate the entity.

apiValue.shortdesc: This property allows content donors to provide a ranking signal to each indexed item It will inform the ranker, allowing it to distinguish more easily between otherwise similar items This is query-independent and should be used to indicate the relative importance of an item w.r.t.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc:
This property allows content donors to provide a ranking signal to each indexed item
It will inform the ranker, allowing it to distinguish more easily between otherwise similar items This is query-independent and should be used to indicate the relative importance of an item w.r.t. all other items for the same application
Expected value [0-100]; preferably integral values
Monotonically increasing with larger values being considered better results iOS 11.0+

apiValue.shortdesc: A description of the rating.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: A description of the rating. E.g. the number of reviewers.

apiValue.shortdesc: User rating of this item out of 5 stars

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: User rating of this item out of 5 stars

apiValue.shortdesc: This attribute indicates the recipient addresses of the document.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: This attribute indicates the recipient addresses of the document.

apiValue.shortdesc: This attribute indicates the reciepients email addresses.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: This attribute indicates the reciepients email addresses. (This is always the email address, and not the human readable version).

apiValue.shortdesc: This attribute indicates the recipients of this item.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: This attribute indicates the recipients of this item.

apiValue.shortdesc: The recording date of the song/composition.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The recording date of the song/composition. This information differs from the contentCreationDate attribute as it indicates the date that the 'art' was created, in contrast to contentCreationDate which for example, could indicate the creation date of an edited or 'mastered' version of the original art.

apiValue.shortdesc: Indicates if red-eye reduction was used to take the picture.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Indicates if red-eye reduction was used to take the picture. Should be 0 for no red-eye, 1 for red-eye

apiValue.shortdesc: For activities, this is the unique identifier for the item this activity is related to.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: For activities, this is the unique identifier for the item this activity is related to. If the item doesn't exist in the index, the activity will not get stored. When the item is deleted, the activity will also be deleted.

apiValue.shortdesc: Resolution height of this image in DPI

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Resolution height of this image in DPI

apiValue.shortdesc: Resolution width of this image in DPI

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Resolution width of this image in DPI

apiValue.shortdesc: Used to provide a link to information about rights held in and over the resource.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Used to provide a link to information about rights held in and over the resource. Typically a Rights element will contain a rights management statement for the resource, or reference a service providing such information. Rights information often /encompasses Intellectual Property Rights (IPR), Copyright, and various Property Rights. If the rights element is absent, no assumptions can be made about the status of these and other rights with respect to the resource.

apiValue.shortdesc: Used to indicate the role of the document creator

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Used to indicate the role of the document creator

apiValue.shortdesc: Security (encryption) method used in the file

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Security (encryption) method used in the file

apiValue.shortdesc: The speed of the item, in kilometers per hour.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The speed of the item, in kilometers per hour.

apiValue.shortdesc: Start date of this item.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Start date of this item.

apiValue.shortdesc: Identifies Province/State of origin according to guidelines established by the provider.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Identifies Province/State of origin according to guidelines established by the provider.

apiValue.shortdesc: Whether the content is prepared for streaming.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Whether the content is prepared for streaming. Should be 0 for not streamable, 1 for streamable.

apiValue.shortdesc: The sub-location (e.g., street number) for the item according to guidelines established by the provider.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The sub-location (e.g., street number) for the item according to guidelines established by the provider.

apiValue.shortdesc: Subject of the this item.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Subject of the this item.

apiValue.shortdesc: If supportsNavigation is set to true, and the item has the latitude and longitude properties set, then the latitude and longitude may be used for navigation.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: If supportsNavigation is set to true, and the item has the latitude and longitude properties set, then the latitude and longitude may be used for navigation. For example, supportsNavigation would be set on a restaurant review, but not on a photo.

apiValue.shortdesc: If supportsPhoneCall is true and the item has the phoneNumbers property, then the phone number may be used to initiate phone calls.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: If supportsPhoneCall is true and the item has the phoneNumbers property, then the phone number may be used to initiate phone calls. This should be used to indicate that using the phone number is appropriate, and a primary action for the user. For example, supportsPhoneCall would be set on a business, but not an academic paper that happens to have phone numbers for the authors or the institution.

apiValue.shortdesc: The tempo of the music contained in the audio file in Beats Per Minute.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The tempo of the music contained in the audio file in Beats Per Minute.

apiValue.shortdesc: Contains the text content of the document.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Contains the text content of the document.

apiValue.shortdesc: Theme of the this item.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Theme of the this item.

apiValue.shortdesc: The location (e.g., street name) for the item according to guidelines established by the provider.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The location (e.g., street name) for the item according to guidelines established by the provider.

apiValue.shortdesc: Optional image data for thumbnail for this item

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Optional image data for thumbnail for this item

apiValue.shortdesc: Optional file URL pointing to a thumbnail image for this item

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Optional file URL pointing to a thumbnail image for this item

apiValue.shortdesc: The time signature of the musical composition contained in the audio/MIDI file.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The time signature of the musical composition contained in the audio/MIDI file. For example: "4/4", "7/8".

apiValue.shortdesc: The timestamp on the item.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The timestamp on the item. This generally is used to indicate the time at which the event captured by the item took place.

apiValue.shortdesc: The title of this particular item.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The title of this particular item. Title of the document, or it could be the title of this mp3 or a subject of a mail message.

apiValue.shortdesc: The total bit rate (audio & video combined) of the media

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The total bit rate (audio & video combined) of the media

apiValue.shortdesc: URL of the item

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: URL of the item

apiValue.shortdesc: This property is used to indicate if the indexed item was created by the user.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc:
This property is used to indicate if the indexed item was created by the user.
It is used to distinguish pushed app content from content that required explicit user interaction Example content that may set this field: user created notes, documents iOS 11.0+

apiValue.shortdesc: This property is used to indicate if the indexed item was selected by the user It is used to distinguish pushed app content from content that a user has chosen to add to a collection Example content that may set this field: downloaded media content, bookmarked websites/news articles iOS 11.0+

apiValueDetail.apiDesc:
This property is used to indicate if the indexed item was selected by the user
It is used to distinguish pushed app content from content that a user has chosen to add to a collection Example content that may set this field: downloaded media content, bookmarked websites/news articles iOS 11.0+

apiValue.shortdesc: This property is used to indicate if the indexed item has been purchased or otherwise acquired by the user Example content are songs bought by a user and made searchable iOS 11.0+

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: This property is used to indicate if the indexed item has been purchased or otherwise acquired by the user Example content are songs bought by a user and made searchable iOS 11.0+

apiValue.shortdesc: A version specifier for this item.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: A version specifier for this item.

apiValue.shortdesc: The video bit rate

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The video bit rate

apiValue.shortdesc: For activities, this is the unique identifier for an item this activity is related to.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: For activities, this is the unique identifier for an item this activity is related to. Unlike relatedUniqueIdentifier, this attribute does not link the life time of the items.

apiValue.shortdesc: The white balance setting of the camera when the image was acquired.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The white balance setting of the camera when the image was acquired. Should be 0 for Auto or 1 for Manual.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: An item that can be indexed and made available to users when they search on their devices.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc: An item that can be indexed and made available to users when they search on their devices.

apiParam.apiDesc:
Should be unique to your application group.
REQUIRED since this is the way you will refer to the item to update the index / delete it from the index Starts with an UUID for ease of use, but you can replace it with an UID of your own before the item is first indexed if you wish.

An optional identifier that represents the "domain" or owner of this item.
This might be an identifier for a mailbox in an account whose indexed data you may want to remove when the account is deleted. In that case the domainIdentifier should be of the form account-id.mailbox-id where account-id and mailbox-id should not contains periods. Calling deleteSearchableItemsWithDomainIdentifiers with account-id.mailbox-id will delete all items with that domain identifier. Calling deleteSearchableItemsWithDomainIdentifiers with account-id will delete all items with account-id and any mailbox-id.
Set of attributes containing meta data for the item

apiValue.shortdesc: Searchable items have an expiration date or time to live.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Searchable items have an expiration date or time to live. By default it's set to 1 month.

apiValue.shortdesc: The type identifier for Mac apps.
